oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Conceptual Framework for Soil management and its effect on Soil Biodiversity in Organic and Low Input Farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Koopmans, Dr. C.J.
Smeding, Dr. F.W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil biology
Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Learning how to manage beneficial soil biological processes may be a key step towards developing sustainable agricultural systems. We designed a conceptual framework linking soil management practices to important soil-life groups and soil fertility services like nutrient cycling, soil structure and disease suppression. We selected a necessary parameter set to gain insight between management, soil life and soil support services. The findings help to develop management practices that optimise yields, soil fertility and biodiversity in organic farming.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Koopmans, Dr. C.J. and Smeding, Dr. F.W. (2008) A Conceptual Framework for Soil management and its effect on Soil Biodiversity in Organic and Low Input Farming. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
